title: Former Mandurah security guard to fight child sex charges
content:
A Greenfields man charged with child sex offences said he will fight the allegations when he appears in the Perth District Court in December. A Greenfields man charged with child sex offences said he will fight the allegations when he appears in the Perth District Court in December. The man is understood to have been a security guard at Peel Health Campus when the alleged offences occurred.

He has been charged with five counts of indecently dealing with a child over 13 and under 16 and one charge of sexual penetration of a child over 13 and under 16.

The charges are believed to relate to a mental health patient who was hospitalised at Peel Health Campus in May 2014.

Peel Health Campus has been contacted for comment. The story first appeared on Mandurah Mail.
